result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin M. Somers

records.addlTxt: Bond and Notice of Hearing mailed to Defendant.  Defendant did not sign Bond after court.

Already posted.  Absolute sobriety. Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or controlled substances.  May take prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages. May not go on tavern/bar premises except for employment purposes.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
1:39 PM - case called.  Defendant Benjamin M. Somers in court.  Attorney Joseph L Bauer in court for Benjamin M. Somers.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bauer - in receipt of complaint - waive reading.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding bond forfeiture of cash bond - requests $100 cash be forfeited.  Defense does not object.  Court orders a forfeiture of $100 with the balance of the cash bond continuing.  Atty Bauer waives time limits.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.

2:10 PM - case called.  Defendant Benjamin M. Somers not in court.  Attorney Andrew R. Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear.  State requests a warrant and bond forfeiture proceedings.  Statement by the Court.  Court issues a warrant - body only - Statewide.
Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

Absolute sobriety.  May not possess or consume alcohol or controlled substances except for any prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages.

1:43 PM - case called.  Defendant Benjamin M. Somers appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint - waive reading - right to counsel.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court questions Defendant.  Responses by Defendant.  Court sets bond.  Court will adjourn this matter to allow the Defendant time to retain an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
